topicv3:
Water m1326522 137,Water Supply and Sanitation Institutions
            m1439231 WAT-3407,Water Supply and Sanitation m1327240 1199

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Water Supply and Sewerage Project in
            Jordan. The project objectives were: (i) to assist the
            Government in developing an optimal investment plan for the
            water sector; (ii) to develop water resources management and
            conservation and water systems operation procedures; (iii)
            to improve and extend water distribution and sewage
            collection systems; (iv) to augment present efforts to
            reduce unaccounted-for water; (v) to reduce groundwater
            pollution by the collection and treatment of sewage; (vi) to
            provide for recycling of treated effluents; and (vii) to
            assist in the continuing development of the Water Authority.
            The key lessons learned were as follows: (a) although the
            Government has a stated intention to restructure public
            sector institutions to improve efficiency, eliminate
            subsidies, and increase participation by the private sector,
            fundamental changes are likely to be needed in the
            institutional and regulatory environment if these intentions
            are to be realized; (b) it is also clearly a risk to rely on
            the provision of technical assistance that is not directly
            linked to the project; and (c) although a covenant might
            appear to provide good leverage for ensuring financial and
            institutional performance improvements, it appears unlikely
            that non-compliance will result in suspension of disbursements.
